channel.title: Player Auctions
channel.description: How does it work? I mean obviously you click the buy button, but do the players that are selling it make the trade? Or do staff from the site do it?

item.title: Player Auctions
item.dc:creator: @Demo1 Demo_
item.description:
@Demo1 wrote:

[quote=“baddy351, post:13, topic:437404”]www.Any4rs.com is great, but use paypal. makes it faster, or else they ask for a picture of id

They are the cheapest site i have seen in a while.[/quote]

Thank you.

Read full topic

item.title: Player Auctions
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:6, topic:437404”][quote author=jmood128 link=topic=540114.msg3954807#msg3954807 date=1332643197]
PA is a great site for buying gold. Though the process they use takes longer then the delivering of the goods, things were still decently fast and I didn’t even worry about being scammed.
[/quote]Depends on your purchase method. I know if you use a card the processing takes less than 10 minutes. At least that’s how long it took when I bought a bit of WoW gold a while ago.[/quote]

I used my credit card thinking it would take no time, but it took like 1 hour for them to verify my card and then with in 7 minutes I had my gold…

Read full topic

item.title: Player Auctions
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Demo_, post:3, topic:437404”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=540114.msg3954803#msg3954803 date=1332642720]
PlayerAuctions holds the money and is the catalyst for the purchase. The buyer and seller are responsible for the actual communication and trading.
[/quote]

What if the seller does not respond?[/quote]There should be a ‘guaranteed’ delivery time, wait for that to expire. If they still refuse to communicate, you can get your money back from PlayerAuctions very easily. You can check your buyers notes and the sellers profile for more communication options usually as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Player Auctions
item.dc:creator: @Demo1 Demo_
item.description:
@Demo1 wrote:

Davidi2:

PlayerAuctions holds the money and is the catalyst for the purchase. The buyer and seller are responsible for the actual communication and trading.

What if the seller does not respond?

Read full topic

item.title: Player Auctions
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

PlayerAuctions holds the money and is the catalyst for the purchase. The buyer and seller are responsible for the actual communication and trading.

Using the rating system you can guarantee you don’t get scammed if you find someone with a decent score (for a seller, at least 30 I’d say) and a very nice price.

Read full topic
